definition: the starting line (of a race)/scratch line (in a relay race)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
(of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
variant of 線|线[xian4]

sentences.english: Standing on the starting line, we're all cowards.
sentences.chinese: 站在起跑线上，我们都是胆小者。

sentences.english: and start the race at the same starting line.
sentences.chinese: 然后在同一起跑线开始赛跑。

sentences.english: At the whistle, players throw themselves forwards from the starting line like arrows.
sentences.chinese: 随着一声哨响，选手们都箭一般地冲出了起跑线。

sentences.english: He pulled off his race number and headed to the tunnel behind the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 他扯下了比赛号码向起跑线后方的通道走去。

sentences.english: So a starting line was made, and away they went.
sentences.chinese: 他们划了条起跑线，出发了。

sentences.english: Open open teaching time, let your child win on the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 开启智教时期，让孩子赢正在起跑线。

sentences.english: Everyone starts from the same starting line.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都从同一个起跑线开始。

sentences.english: This should be China to rush toward mankind's civilization new mileage of rise run line.
sentences.chinese: 这应该是中国奔向人类文明新里程的起跑线。

sentences.english: The runners got into position the starting line.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑运动员友进褥起跑线上赌位帜。

sentences.english: In short, the DOE is starting from scratch.
sentences.chinese: 简而言之，能源部又回到了起跑线。

sentences.english: What is the starting line like?
sentences.chinese: 或者，起跑线是什么样的？

sentences.english: They were at the starting line and all set to begin.
sentences.chinese: 他们都在起跑线上，随时可开始。

sentences.english: And if there are inhibitions on that starting line, you're not going to do a good job.
sentences.chinese: 从起跑线就有了禁忌，你就干不好。

sentences.english: I sometimes nant to have a time when.
sentences.chinese: 在爱的起跑线上，我都很小心的走好每一步。

definition: to start running/the start of a race
to jump the gun/to make a false start
marathon (loanword)
race course
race (running)/to race (running)
(slang) to rely on one's father's wealth or prestige to get ahead
100-meter dash
all-round education (contrasted with 應試教育|应试教育[ying4 shi4 jiao4 yu4], exam-oriented education)
exam-oriented education/teaching to the test
the end/end point/finishing line (in a race)/destination/terminus/CL:個|个[ge4]
starting pistol

college entrance exam (especially as abbr. for 普通高等學校招生全國統一考試|普通高等学校招生全国统一考试[Pu3 tong1 Gao1 deng3 Xue2 xiao4 Zhao1 sheng1 Quan2 guo2 Tong3 yi1 Kao3 shi4])/(Tw) entrance exam for senior government service posts (abbr. for 公務人員高等考試|公务人员高等考试)
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO)/abbr. for 國際奧林匹克數學競賽|国际奥林匹克数学竞赛[Guo2 ji4 Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Shu4 xue2 Jing4 sai4]
relay race/CL:場|场[chang3]
achievement/performance records/grades/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
